com.salimov.yurii.controller.admin

Class AdminSectionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salimov.yurii.controller.admin.AdminSectionController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/admin/section")
 @ComponentScan(basePackages="com.salimov.yurii.service")
public class AdminSectionController
extends java.lang.Object
    The class implements a set of methods for working with main ModelAndView objects and object of Section class or subclasses for admins. Class methods create and return modelsAndView, depending on the request.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yurii Salimov (yurii.alex.salimov@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    Section, SectionService, AdminMVFabric

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private MainMVFabric fabric
      The implementation of the interface provides a set of standard methods for creates and returns the main modelAndViews.
      private SectionService sectionService
      The implementation of the interface describes a set of methods for working with objects of the Section class.

      • addSection

        @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addSection(@RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                            java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                            java.lang.String description,
                                                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="keywords")
                                                                                                                            java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="main_photo")
                                                                                                                            org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile photoFile,
                                                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="is_valid")
                                                                                                                            boolean isValid,
                                                                                                                            org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView modelAndView)
        Adds new article and redirects by url /admin/section/{url}. Request mapping: /admin/section/add Method: POST
        Parameters:
        title - a title of the new section.
        description - a description of the new section.
        keywords - a keywords of the new section.
        photoFile - a file of main photo to the new section.
        isValid - a validated of the new section.
        modelAndView - a object of class ModelAndView for to update.
        Returns:
        The ready object of class ModelAndView.
        See Also:
        Section, Photo

      • addSection

        @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=GET)
public void addSection()
                                                                            throws org.springframework.data.mapping.model.IllegalMappingException
        The method throws an exception in the case of reference to it. The exception sender: "GET method in "/admin/section/add" is not supported!" Request mapping: /admin/section/add Method: POST
        Throws:
        org.springframework.data.mapping.model.IllegalMappingException - thrown when an error occurs reading the mapping between object and datastore.

      • updateSection

        @RequestMapping(value="/update",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView updateSection(@RequestParam(value="url")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String url,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String description,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="keywords")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="main_photo")
                                                                                                                                  org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile photoFile,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="photo_action")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String photoAction,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="is_valid")
                                                                                                                                  boolean isValid,
                                                                                                                                  org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView modelAndView)
        Updates and save the section with url and redirects by url /admin/section/{url}. Request mapping: /admin/section/update Method: POST
        Parameters:
        url - a url of the section to update.
        title - a new title to the section.
        description - a new title to the section.
        keywords - a new title to the section.
        photoFile - a file of photo to the section.
        photoAction - a action on the photo.
        isValid - a validated of the section.
        modelAndView - a object of class ModelAndView for to update.
        Returns:
        The ready object of class ModelAndView.
        See Also:
        Section, Photo
